result.execSummary:
The defendant Javier H Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Straight-Time. Court will allow to be served at Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.                
-Sentence credit of 27 days is granted. 
-Defendant may be returned to MSDF- Forthwith.
Concurrent with: -To any other sentence - currently serving a revocation sentence at Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.
-Costs to be converted to a civil judgment.
10/27/22 Restitution for Kohl's of $666.89 and $131.97 to be paid within 90 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Jury status hearing on September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:55 AM Defendant Javier H Perez in court, in custody (video), with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Court to address prompt disposition. 

Atty Nimmers states that she hopes to get an offer to co-inside with Mr. Perez's custodial status. Atty Nimmer requests to set plea/sentencing and jury trial date. 

State received prompt disposition on 06/13/2022. Jury trial would have to be set by 10/11/2022. Court sets. 

Defendant to be produced by 09/20/2022 from MSDF.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for August 19, 2022.
Hearing on July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:05 AM Defendant Javier H Perez appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer who appeared by Zoom.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  The defendant to appear by Zoom from MSDF at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty Nimmer

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Amanda Nimmer
Detainer placed at: Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with and Kohl's Department Store.  Defendant to have no contact with Witness A/Witness B/Witness C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

02:48 PM Defendant Javier H Perez in court by zoom video, in custody at Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Court was notified the defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation but they were unable to appoint by today's date.  An attorney will be appointed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Attorney Farina states the defendant has submitted a request for prompt disposition and the deadline for the State to bring this case to Trial is October 11, 2022.  Court will set a status of counsel date as soon as possible with the hope an attorney has been appointed by the next date.  Clerk's office to set up video appearance for the defendant from Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  

MINUTES UPDATED:  Public Defender Law intern appeared in court stating counsel was just appointed.  Court informs of next date and Public Defender states they will be able to speak to the defendant before the next date.  Hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
